channel.title: Portforwarding :]
channel.description: ok i portforwarded and everything my server can getup on the server status page and no1 can connect still why is this? i have a router & a modem...Is this a problem?

item.title: Portforwarding :]
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

Pure str433:

same… i got no-ip, portforwarded, and noone can get on neither can i put it on the server status list.

Darque Star:

me too, same problem, i have netgear RP614 V4 Router and Westell Modem! its pissing me off!

D Weezy 9964:

me too lol

WOW, you really helped him.

Anyways, i’m guessing you have norton anti virus? if not you have an anti virus some anti viruses have a worm protection thing, well disable your anti-virus using, Run --> msconfig, disable the startup AND services of the antivirus ONLY. Trying it next time, btw you might have dynamic IP, so the little two computers at the bottom right hand corner(Connections) double click it, click the tab support, look at IP. the first one. Portfoward to that one.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding :]
item.dc:creator: @Darque_Star Darque Star
item.description:
@Darque_Star wrote:

well ok dude, how about you try LETTING the ports through, i have an idea -

STEP 1
Click The Start Button
In The Start Menu, Click Connect to…SHOW ALL CONNECTIONS
Right-Click The “Internet Connection” With The Globe In The Background && PC In Front!
Click Properties…
Click “settings”

STEP 2
PORTFORWARDING PRIVATE SERVER
click “add…”
Description of service: MOPAR
Name Of IP Address: (YOUR LOCALHOST IP) Like…192.168.1.1
External Port: 43594
Internal Port: 43594
TCP: YES
UDP: NO

STEP 3
PORTFORWARDING NO-IP
click “add…”
Description of service: NO-IP
Name Of IP Address: (YOUR LOCALHOST IP) Like…192.168.1.1
External Port: 8245
Internal Port: 8245
TCP: YES
UDP: NO

STEP 4
RECOMPILE AND START SERVER!

[u]Remember to enjoy!

FAQ -
How do i find out my ip?
click the start menu
click “run…”
in the text field put this in

cmd

when the CMD comes up, type ipconfig and there you go!

[red]100%[/red] [blue]Creds To Darque Star (NOT LEECHED) :D[/blue]

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding :]
item.dc:creator: @Pure_str433 Pure str433
item.description:
@Pure_str433 wrote:

ok ive done that… now the no-ip symble is smiling… does that mean its online?

OMG THEN I ENTERED MY NO-IP IN MOPARSCAPE WEBCLIENT AND IT LOGGED ON!

just that server status sais its offline…

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding :]
item.dc:creator: @Darque_Star Darque Star
item.description:
@Darque_Star wrote:

you need hamachi & no-ip :D[br][size=1]Posted on: November 04, 2007, 10:27:12 AM[/size][hr]ok so start your hamachi server, and then go into no-ip…click ‘Options’ (IN NO-IP) then click the ‘connection’ tab check the two boxes in there, click the arrow (and a sliding menu comes down) click #.###.#.## hamachi network. Do that with both of the sliding menu’s! and there you go, you have to have HAMACHI AND NO-IP ON to have ur server work, remember, it didnt work for me. but it might for you.

Download No-ip at http://www.no-ip.com

Download Hamachi at http://www.hamachi.cc

Read full topic
